benchmark_details.name: BizBench: A Quantitative Reasoning Benchmark for Business and Finance
benchmark_details.overview: BizBench is a benchmark for evaluating modelsâ€™ ability to reason about realistic financial problems, comprising eight quantitative reasoning tasks focusing on question-answering (QA) over financial data via program synthesis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the development of better models for business and finance by evaluating financial quantitative reasoning.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark does not span the entire domains of business and finance and currently only contains English text.

data.source: Derived from financial datasets and annotated by financial professionals.
data.size: 8 tasks across various datasets including 8,845 data points for SEC-Num
data.format: mixed-format including tables and natural language questions
data.annotation: Combination of manual annotation by financial professionals and code generation by LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is measured by comparing model-generated outputs with ground truth reference values.
methodology.interpretation: An answer is considered correct if it is within 1% of the reference output.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4 achieved significant improvements in performance on BizBench tasks.
methodology.validation: Validation was performed via comparison against ground truth answers.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data primarily consists of public records under strict government regulations.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: All annotators were informed of and consented to the intended use of their data.
